1.Pros: They were a great employer. It was a lot of hard work, but they were a fair employer and I enjoyed working for the company.
1.Cons: It was a lot of hard work. The pay was minimum wage, but that was what the skill level required.

2.Pros: they always keep you busy, and you learn how fast food is made
2.Cons: some of the employees take it for granted and get snooty

4.Pros: Discount meals were great if you wanted to punish your body even more than just standing next to a deep fryer all day.
4.Cons: Poor management skills and co workers who make you uncomfortable were pretty lame and I wouldn't go back if you asked me to.

5.Pros: Flexible schedule, reasonable hours, definitely many opportunities to move up,management is fun to work with as long as there are enough employees working
5.Cons: Call outs galore, hard to balance school and work life

6.Pros: I really enjoyed working for McDonald's. Flexible schedule and supportive employees.

7.Pros: fun stafflayback attitudeeasy learning curvesuper super easy
7.Cons: Awful payawful managers(typically)a lot of mind-numbing repetitiveness...                    if you are not okay with constantly repeating the same/similar phrases for your entire shift, and constantly doing the same thing, then by all means this is a great location for you.

8.Pros: It's good to get a night job. It has good hours to work with. It's close to my house.

9.Pros: free food and the uniforms are free
9.Cons: rude management and the customers are not pleasant
